items.sentence: You can\'t just not pay someone for work you hired them to do.
Tom sat there silently watching Mary eat the last of the food.
Tom wishes he could speak French as well as he speaks English.
Tom doesn\'t yet know that Mary will be at his birthday party.
Tom is the only one in our family who has ever been to Boston.
I wonder whether Tom will go to Boston or Chicago next summer.
I wish I had a dollar for every time I\'ve heard you say that.
I still have difficulty in making myself understood in French.
I suspected Tom and Mary were planning on doing that together.
Don\'t believe a word Tom says. He\'s lying through his teeth.
I drank beer for the first time when I was thirteen years old.
Our city police have a new campaign targeting drunken driving.
Tom asked Mary to stay at home until the babysitter got there.
Tom Jackson\'s books have been translated into many languages.
Tom wasn\'t stupid enough to tell Mary what he really thought.
Tom parked as close to Mary\'s apartment building as he could.
Tom rented a car at the airport and drove it to Mary\'s house.
It seems I\'m the only one here who knows how to speak French.
Instead of doing what he was supposed to do, Tom went fishing.
We\'re not at home now. Please leave a message after the beep.
The owner of this apartment building lives on the third floor.
The police promised Tom that they would look for his daughter.
The world needs to develop new energy sources in place of oil.
Tom and John went to the bar last night to pick up some girls.
My grandparents have smallpox vaccination scars on their arms.
Tom can\'t understand why Mary won\'t agree to help him study.
Tom didn\'t go to school yesterday because he didn\'t want to.
Tom doesn\'t like people who don\'t take their jobs seriously.
Even though he was a child, he worked hard to help his mother.
How would you like to come and spend a week with us next year?
I came to Japan four years ago intending to stay for one year.
I think Tom is probably better at French than you think he is.
I\'m getting older and I don\'t want to work at night anymore.
Tom said he saw something suspicious on the morning Mary died.
Tom said that he thought the economy was likely to get better.
Tom didn\'t get paid as much as they told him they\'d pay him.
You shouldn\'t hate people. You should only hate what they do.
Tom volunteered to do all the things no one else wanted to do.
Tom can already play the drums better than I could at his age.
Tom and Mary spent the evening talking about John\'s problems.
I\'ve been mentally preparing myself for this for a long time.
It\'s hard to find a bench that you can sleep on in this city.
The other girls in Mary\'s class teased her about her clothes.
I realized later that the person I was talking to wasn\'t Tom.
Tom hasn\'t told me where he\'s planning on staying in Boston.
Tom told me you only want two hundred dollars for your guitar.
Tom tried to cut the delicious-looking meat with a dull knife.
Tom used to walk into the bar and order three beers right off.
Tom is much better at French now than he was three months ago.
Tom took some money out of his pocket and put it on the table.
